data.name: TVAR
data.description: a deep learning approach for assessing tissue-specific functional effects of non-coding variants

evidence: "TVAR is a tissue-specific functional annotation tool of non-coding variants based on multi-label deep learning."
Usage is via command-line scripts, e.g., "python TVar_cpu.py -m fea -i ./input/input.vcf" and "python TVar_gpu.py -m score -i ./input/input.vcf", indicating an end-user application workflow.

Environment setup is described via conda and direct script execution from the repository: "We provided a list of packages (tvar.yml) required by the TVAR runtime environment. The command: conda env create -f tvar.yml can complete the configuration of the TVAR operating environment."
